Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as the ad does not provide any evidence or explanation to support the assertion that the "most loved line" in the movie was a mistake.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that there is a specific "most loved line" in the movie without providing any information or context about what that line might be.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the "most loved line" in the movie was a mistake by stating that it was never meant to be said, which implies that it was unintentional.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the significance of the line by referring to it as the "most famous movie line ever" without providing any evidence or data to support this claim.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating bias in the provided claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times as it includes a misleading ad that uses a picture of an actress from the movie to support the claim without providing any substantial information or discussion.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no alternative explanation bias in the provided claim.
